title: Introducing Showboat and Rodney, so agents can demo what they've built
description: Simon Willison introduces new tools Showboat and Rodney that enable AI agents to demonstrate and showcase their work. This addresses a key gap in agentic AI workflows - the ability for AI systems to present their outputs in accessible, demoable formats.
author: Simon Willison

title: GLM-5: From Vibe Coding to Agentic Engineering
description: Simon Willison covers the new GLM-5 model, a 754B parameter MIT-licensed model. The article explores the evolution from 'vibe coding' to 'agentic engineering' - a paradigm shift in how developers interact with and direct AI systems.
author: Simon Willison

title: How Generative and Agentic AI Shift Concern from Technical Debt to Cognitive Debt
description: Simon Willison explores how the rise of generative and agentic AI is changing the type of debt developers accumulate. Rather than technical debt, the new concern is 'cognitive debt' - the mental overhead of understanding, maintaining, and orchestrating AI systems and their outputs.
author: Simon Willison

title: How StrongDM's AI team build serious software without even looking at the code
description: Simon Willison profiles StrongDM's AI team workflow, highlighting how they build production software using AI coding tools with minimal manual coding. The piece explores the future of software development where human oversight shifts from writing code to directing AI agents.
author: Simon Willison

title: Improving Code Generation via Small Language Model-as-a-judge
description: Research paper introducing a novel approach to improving code generation quality by using small language models as judges to evaluate and refine code generated by larger models. This addresses computational efficiency and quality control in AI-assisted coding.
author: Research Team

title: Canonical Intermediate Representation for LLM-based optimization problem formulation and code generation
description: Paper introduces a canonical intermediate representation specifically designed for LLM-based optimization problem formulation and code generation, enabling better structure and reproducibility in AI-generated optimization code.
author: Zhongyuan Lyu, Shuoyu Hu, et al.

title: AI doesn't reduce work, it intensifies it
description: Hacker News discussion examining how AI coding tools don't actually reduce workload but instead require skilled programmers to be more effective. The community discusses the reality that AI tools amplify productivity rather than replace expertise.
author: Hacker News Community

title: Ask HN: What are you working on? (February 2026)
description: Monthly Hacker News thread showcasing community projects. Includes discussions of AI coding tools, screen capture utilities, and various developer projects, providing insight into what developers are actively building with AI assistance.
author: Hacker News Community

title: Amjad Masad on AI disrupting coding jobs
description: Replit CEO Amjad Masad shares insights on how AI tools are disrupting traditional coding jobs, with discussion of tools like GitHub Copilot automating tasks. Content includes reflections on Replit's journey to $3B valuation and the future of AI-assisted development.
author: Amjad Masad

title: The Rise of Coding Agents and Functional AGI
description: Tom Bilyeu's Impact Theory podcast features Amjad Masad discussing the rise of coding agents, functional AGI, and how Replit is building infrastructure for AI-powered software development. Masad shares his vision for the future of programming.
author: Amjad Masad (guest), Tom Bilyeu (host)

title: State of AI in 2026: LLMs, Coding, Scaling Laws, China, Agents, GPUs, AGI
description: Lex Fridman's 4-hour 39-minute deep dive with Nathan Lambert and Sebastian Raschka covering the state of AI in 2026. Topics include AI coding tools, scaling laws, AI agents, GPU developments, and the impact of LLMs on programmer productivity and happiness.
author: Lex Fridman (host), Nathan Lambert, Sebastian Raschka (guests)

title: Learn how to be an effective full-stack engineer with Claude Code
description: Eivind Kjosbakken shares practical workflows for using Claude Code as a full-stack engineer. The article covers planning, implementation, and collaboration patterns when working with AI coding assistants.
author: Eivind Kjosbakken

title: AI Coding Summit 2026
description: Announcement of the AI Coding Summit 2026 (Feb 26-27), bringing together developers and researchers to explore how AI is transforming software development. The summit covers AI coding tools, workflows, and best practices.
author: GitNation

title: Data Science Roadmap 2026
description: Shirin Khosravi Jam's comprehensive roadmap for data science in 2026 includes coverage of AI coding assistants like Claude and Cursor as essential tools for modern data scientists and developers.
author: Shirin Khosravi Jam

title: Best Open Source LLM February 2026
description: Monthly rankings and analysis of the best open-source LLMs for February 2026, evaluating models for coding capabilities, performance benchmarks, and practical applications in AI-assisted development.
author: WhatLLM

title: AI News Briefs for February 2026
description: roundup of AI news including fast LLM inference tricks from Anthropic and OpenAI, new model releases, and developments in AI coding tools and infrastructure.
author: Radical Data Science

title: The Changelog: The tech monoculture is finally breaking
description: The Changelog podcast discusses how the technology monoculture is fragmenting with the rise of diverse AI tools, frameworks, and development approaches. Episode explores the shift away from singular tech stacks to more diverse ecosystems.
author: Adam Stacoviak, Jerod Santo
